ibis.ipl
Interface WriteMessage

public interface WriteMessage

A message used to write data from a SendPort to one or more ReceivePorts.

A WriteMessage is obtained from a SendPort through the SendPort.newMessage method. At most one WriteMessage is alive at one time for a given SendPort. When a message is alive and a new message is requested, the requester is blocked until the live message is finished.

For all read methods in this class, the invariant is that the reads must match the writes one by one. An exception to this rule is that an array written with any of the writeArray methods can be read by ReadMessage.readObject(). Likewise, an array written with the writeByteBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer) method can be read by ReadMessage.readObject() (resulting in a byte array), and also by the ReadMessage.readArray(byte[]) method. In contrast, an array written with writeObject cannot be read with readArray, because writeObject does duplicate detection, and may have written only a handle. However, an array written with writeArray(byte[]) can be read with ReadMessage.readByteBuffer(ByteBuffer).

The writeObject(Object) and writeString(String) methods do duplicate checks if the underlying serialization stream is an object serialization stream: if the object was already written to this message, a handle for this object is written instead of the object itself.

When the port type has the PortType.CONNECTION_ONE_TO_MANY or PortType.CONNECTION_MANY_TO_MANY capability set, no exceptions are thrown by write methods in the write message. Instead, the exception may be passed on to the lostConnection upcall, in case a SendPortDisconnectUpcall is registered. This allows a multicast to continue to the other destinations. Ultimately, the finish method will throw an exception.

Data may be streamed, so the user is not allowed to change the data pushed into this message. It is only safe to touch the data after it has actually been sent, which can be ensured by either calling flush(), finish() or reset(), or a send() followed by a corresponding sync(int).

Method Detail

send

int send()
         throws IOException
Starts sending the message to all ReceivePorts its SendPort is connected to. Data may be streamed, so the user is not allowed to change the data pushed into this message, as the send is NON-blocking. It is only safe to touch the data after it has actually been sent, which can be ensured by either calling finish() or reset(), or a sync(int) corresponding to this send. The send method returns a ticket, which can be used as a parameter to the sync(int) method, which will block until the data corresponding to this ticket can be used again.

Returns:
a ticket.
Throws:
IOException - an error occurred

sync

void sync(int ticket)
          throws IOException
Blocks until the data of the send which returned the ticket parameter may be used again. It also synchronizes with respect to all sends before that. If ticket does not correspond to any send, it blocks until all outstanding sends have been processed.

Parameters:
ticket - the ticket number.
Throws:
IOException - an error occurred

flush

void flush()
           throws IOException
Blocks until all objects written to this message can be used again.

Throws:
IOException - an error occurred

reset

void reset()
           throws IOException
Resets the state of any objects already written to the stream. This means that the WriteMessage "forgets" which objects already have been written with it.

Throws:
IOException - an error occurred

finish

long finish()
            throws IOException
If needed, send, and then block until the entire message has been sent and clear the message. The number of bytes written in this message is returned. Even for multicast messages, the size only counts once.

Returns:
the number of bytes written in this message.
Throws:
IOException - an error occurred

finish

void finish(IOException exception)
This method can be used to inform Ibis that one of the WriteMessage methods has thrown an IOException. It implies a finish().

Parameters:
exception - the exception that was thrown.

bytesWritten

long bytesWritten()
                  throws IOException
Returns the number of bytes read from this message. Note that for streaming implementations (i.e., messages with an unlimited capacity) this number may not be exact because of intermediate buffering. Even for multicast messages, the size only counts once.

Returns:
the number of bytes written to this message.
Throws:
IOException - an error occurred.

capacity

int capacity()
             throws IOException
Returns the maximum number of bytes that will fit into this message.

Returns:
the maximum number of bytes that will fit into this message or -1 when the message size is unlimited
Throws:
IOException - an error occurred.

remaining

int remaining()
              throws IOException
Returns the remaining number of bytes that can be written into this message.

Returns:
the remaining number of bytes that can be written into this message or -1 when the message size is unlimited
Throws:
IOException - an error occurred.

localPort

SendPort localPort()
Returns the SendPort of this WriteMessage.

Returns:
the SendPort of this WriteMessage.

writeBoolean

void writeBoolean(boolean value)
                  throws IOException
Writes a boolean value to the message. This method throws an IOException if the underlying serialization stream can only do byte serialization. (See PortType.SERIALIZATION_BYTE).

Parameters:
value - the boolean value to write.
Throws:
IOException - an error occurred

writeString

void writeString(String value)
                 throws IOException
Writes a String to the message. This method throws an IOException if the underlying serialization stream can only do byte serialization. (See PortType.SERIALIZATION_BYTE). If the underlying serialization stream is an object serialization stream, a duplicate check for this String object is performed: if the object was already written to this message, a handle for this object is written instead of the object itself.

Parameters:
value - the string to write.
Throws:
IOException - an error occurred

writeObject

void writeObject(Object value)
                 throws IOException
Writes a Serializable object to the message. This method throws an IOException if the underlying serialization stream cannot do object serialization. (See PortType.SERIALIZATION_OBJECT). A duplicate check for this String object is performed: if the object was already written to this message, a handle for this object is written instead of the object itself.

Parameters:
value - the object value to write.
Throws:
IOException - an error occurred

writeArray

void writeArray(boolean[] value)
                throws IOException
Writes an array to the message. This method throws an IOException if the underlying serialization stream can only do byte serialization. (See PortType.SERIALIZATION_BYTE). No duplicate check is performed for this array! This method is just a shortcut for doing: writeArray(val, 0, val.length);

Parameters:
value - the array to be written.
Throws:
IOException - an error occurred

writeArray

void writeArray(byte[] value)
                throws IOException
Writes an array to the message. No duplicate check is performed for this array! This method is just a shortcut for doing: writeArray(val, 0, val.length);

Parameters:
value - the array to be written.
Throws:
IOException - an error occurred

writeArray

void writeArray(boolean[] value,
                int offset,
                int length)
                throws IOException
Writes a slice of an array. The slice starts at offset off. This method throws an IOException if the underlying serialization stream can only do byte serialization. (See PortType.SERIALIZATION_BYTE). No duplicate check is performed for this array!

Parameters:
value - the array to be written
offset - offset in the array
length - the number of elements to be written
Throws:
IOException - an error occurred

writeByteBuffer

void writeByteBuffer(ByteBuffer value)
                     throws IOException
Writes the contents of the byte buffer (between its current position and its limit). This method is allowed for all serialization types, even PortType.SERIALIZATION_BYTE.

Parameters:
value - the byte buffer from which data is to be written
Throws:
IOException - an error occurred
